resources.name: store new video
resources.description:
send new video from url into stream

``
validation:
       'title' => 'required|min:2|max:155',
            'description'   => 'nullable|max:255',
            'video_url' => 'required|url',
            'thumbnail_time'    => 'integer',
            'watermark_url' => 'nullable|url',
            'watermark_position'=> 'nullable|in:TopRight,TopLeft,BottomRight,BottomLeft,CenterCenter',
            'watermark_offset'  => 'integer|4000',
						``

resources.name: get video detail
resources.description:
send new video from url into stream

``
validation:
       'title' => 'required|min:2|max:155',
            'description'   => 'nullable|max:255',
            'video_url' => 'required|url',
            'thumbnail_time'    => 'integer',
            'watermark_url' => 'nullable|url',
            'watermark_position'=> 'nullable|in:TopRight,TopLeft,BottomRight,BottomLeft,CenterCenter',
            'watermark_offset'  => 'integer|4000',
						``

resources.name: Update Setting
resources.description:
Update user settings.
```
POST /api/user/settings

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```

# Payload

## name `string` `required`
Name of the attribute you are going to update. Allowed attributes are:
- color (HEX format)
- first_name
- last_name
- address
- state
- city
- postal_code
- country (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format)
- phone_number
- timezone (1.0, 2.0, 3.0...)
- emoji_type (twemoji|system)
- theme_mode (light|dark|system)

## value `string|integer` `required`
The string or integer value

resources.name: File Chunks Upload
resources.description:
If you want to upload big files, sometimes you have to cut the files into many chunks and upload them one by one. This API endpoint gather these chunks and join them into one piece of file on the backend.
```
POST /api/upload/chunks

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```

# Payload
## name `string` `required`
The file name, must be the same for all file chunks

## chunk `file` `required`
The file or part of the file as a chunk

## extension `string` `required`
The file extension

## is_last_chunk `boolean` `required`
Determine if the sending file or chunk is the last one in upload queue

## parent_id `uuid`
The id of the parent folder. If id is not set, the files will be uploaded into home location

## path `string`
The directory path of the file. Use it when you'd like to upload folder and recreate folder structure in the backend. E.g. `/Documents/Photos/wallpaper.jpg`

resources.name: File Upload
resources.description:
Simple file upload.
```
POST /api/upload

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```

# Payload
## name `string` `required`
The file name, must be the same for all file chunks

## file `file` `required`
The file or part of the file as a chunk

## extension `string` `required`
The file extension

## parent_id `uuid`
The uuid of the parent folder. If it's not set, then the files will be uploaded into home location

## path `string`
The directory path of the file. Use it when you'd like to upload folder and recreate folder structure in the backend. E.g. `/Documents/Photos/wallpaper.jpg`

```
POST /api/create-folder

```

resources.name: Rename Item
resources.description:
Rename file or folder.
```
PATCH /api/rename/{item_id}

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```

# URL Parameters

#### item_id `string`

# Payload

## name `string` `required`
The new item name

## type `string` `required`
The type of the renaming item. Allowed types are `folder` or `file`

resources.name: Delete Item
resources.description:
Delete one or many files or folders.
```
POST /api/remove

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```

# Payload

## items `array` `required`
The array of the items

## items.*.force_delete `boolean` `required`
Determine how to delete the item. If value is set to yes, then the item will be immediately deleted from the database and storage. If false, the item will be deleted softly. 

## items.*.type `string` `required`
The type of the deleting item. Allowed types are `folder` or `file`.

## items.*.id `uuid` `required`
The ID of the item.

resources.name: Move Item
resources.description:
Move one or many files or folders elsewhere
```
POST /api/move

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```

# Payload
## to_id `uuid`
The id of the parent folder, there the items move. If null, then the items will be moved into the home location

## items `array` `required`
The array of the items

## items.*.type `string` `required`
The type of the deleting item. Allowed types are `folder` or `file`.

## items.*.id `uuid` `required`
The ID of the item.

resources.name: ZIP & Download
resources.description:
Zip single or multiple files or folders and download them immediately.
```
GET /api/zip?items={item_id}|{type},{item_id}|{type}

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```
Example of request 
```
GET /api/zip?items=03a76121-369e-4473-9baf-1e4225823ed1|folder,0a1122fa-cba2-45dc-9b8d-7d5b5feaab57|file
```

# Query Parameters
## items `item_id`|`type`
`items` parameter contain 2 values separated by pipe `|`. You can apply multiple items separated by comma `,`. Please see the example above.

#### 1. item_id `uuid` `required`
Your search query to find files or folders

#### 2. type `string` `required`
The type of the requested item. Allowed types are `folder` or `file`.

If you want to upload big files, sometimes you have to cut the files into many chunks and upload them one by one. This API endpoint gather these chunks and join them into one piece of file on the backend.

## is_last_chunk `boolean` `required`
Determine if the sending file or chunk is the last one in upload queue

## parent_id `uuid`
The uuid of the parent folder. If it's not set, then the files will be uploaded into home location

## path `string`
The directory path of the file. Use it when you'd like to upload folder and recreate folder structure in the backend. E.g. `/Documents/Photos/wallpaper.jpg`

resources.name: Share Item
resources.description:
Share publicly file or folder.
```
POST /api/share

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```

# Payload

## id `uuid` `required`
The id of the item you want to share

## type `string` `required`
The type of the renaming item. Allowed types are `folder` or `file`

## isPassword `boolean`
Determine if the folder would be publicly shared or privately secured with the password

## password `string` `required when isPassword:yes`
The password which protect the content stored in the folder

## permission `string` `required when is folder`
The edit permissions for the folder. Allowed permission types are `editor` or `visitor`.

1. editor - Can upload, delete and manage items
2. visitor - Can only browse throught the content and download them

## expiration `integer`
The time in hours the link expire automatically

## emails `array`
The array of the valid email adresses

resources.name: Update Sharing
resources.description:
Update publicly shared file or folder.
```
PATCH /api/share/{token}

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```
# URL Parameters

#### token `string`

# Payload

## protected `boolean`
Determine if the folder would be publicly shared or privately secured with the password

## password `string` `required when isPassword:yes`
The password which protect the content stored in the folder

## permission `string` `required when is folder`
The edit permissions for the folder. Allowed permission types are `editor` or `visitor`.

1. editor - Can upload, delete and manage items
2. visitor - Can only browse throught the content and download them

## expiration `integer`
The time in hours the link expire automatically

resources.name: Create Team Folder
resources.description:
Create new Team Folder and invite new members into it.
```
POST /api/teams/folders

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```

# Payload

## name `string` `required`
The name of the team folder.

## invitations `array` `required`
The array of invitations which specify who invite to the team folder.

## invitations.*.email `string` `required`
The email address of the user

## invitations.*.permission `string` `required`
The permission for the user. Can be `can-edit` or `can-view`

## invitations.*.type `string` `required`
The type of the object, `invitation` value is required

resources.name: Convert Into Team Folder
resources.description:
It convert existing user folder into the Team Folder and invite new members into it.

```
POST /api/teams/folders/{folder_id}/convert

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```
# URL Parameters

#### folder_id `string`

# Payload

## invitations `array` `required`
The array of invitations which specify who invite to the team folder.

## invitations.*.email `string` `required`
The email address of the user

## invitations.*.permission `string` `required`
The permission for the user. Can be `can-edit` or `can-view`

## invitations.*.type `string` `required`
The type of the object, `invitation` value is required

resources.name: Update Team Folder
resources.description:
It update Team Folder members or invite new members into it.
```
PATCH /api/teams/folders/{folder_id}

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```
# URL Parameters

#### folder_id `string`

# Payload

## invitations `array` `required`
The array of actual invitations. If you'd like to invite new member, include it in invitations array. If you'd like to remove invitation, just void the member in invitations array. The backend synchronize the list.
 
## invitations.*.email `string` `required`
The email address of the user

## invitations.*.permission `string` `required`
The permission for the user. Can be `can-edit` or `can-view`

## invitations.*.type `string` `required`
The type of the object, `invitation` value is required

## members `array` `required`
The array of actual members. If you void some actual member in the list, the member will be detached from the members of the team folder. The backend synchronize the list.

## members.*.id `uuid` `required`
The email address of the user

## members.*.permission `string` `required`
The permission for the user. Can be `can-edit` or `can-view`

# URL Parameters

#### invitation_id `string`

resources.name: Create File Request
resources.description:
Create new file request.
```
POST /api/file-request

Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer
```

# Payload

## email `string`
The email address to send upload request link via email. 

## notes `string`
The notes for the upload request recipient.

## folder_id `string`
The id of the parent folder under which upload request folder will be created. If not set, the folder with upladed files will be created in home directory.

## name `string`
The name of folder which will be created after upload request will be filled.

resources.name: Get File Request Detail
resources.description:
Get details from file request.

```
GET /api/file-request/{file_request_id}

Accept: application/json
```
# URL Parameters

#### file_request_id `string`

resources.name: Mark As Filled
resources.description:
Mark file request as filled. This close the door for uploading and send notification for the user about this event.
```
POST /api/file-request/{file_request_id}

Accept: application/json
```
# URL Parameters

#### file_request_id `string`

resources.name: Create Folder
resources.description:
Create new folder within File Request.
```
POST /api/file-request/{file_request_id}/create-folder

Accept: application/json
```
# URL Parameters

#### file_request_id `string`

# Payload

## name `string` `required`
The name of the new folder

## parent_id `uuid`
The id of the parent folder, if not set, then the folder will be created in the home directory

resources.name: Rename Item
resources.description:
Rename file or folder within File Request.
```
PATCH /api/file-request/{file_request_id}/rename/{item_id}

Accept: application/json
```
# URL Parameters

#### file_request_id `string`

# Payload

## name `string` `required`
The new item name

## type `string` `required`
The type of the renaming item. Allowed types are `folder` or `file`

resources.name: Delete Item
resources.description:
Delete one or many files or folders within File Request.
```
POST /api/file-request/{file_request_id}/remove

Accept: application/json
```
# URL Parameters

#### file_request_id `string`

# Payload

## items `array` `required`
The array of the items

## items.*.force_delete `boolean` `required`
Determine how to delete the item. If value is set to yes, then the item will be immediately deleted from the database and storage. If false, the item will be softly deleted. 

## items.*.type `string` `required`
The type of the deleting item. Allowed types are `folder` or `file`.

## items.*.id `uuid` `required`
The ID of the item.

resources.name: Move Item
resources.description:
Move one or many items elsewhere within File Request.
```
POST /api/file-request/{file_request_id}/move

Accept: application/json
```
# URL Parameters

#### file_request_id `string`

# Payload
## to_id `uuid`
The id of the parent folder, there the items move. If null, then the items will be moved into the home location

## items `array` `required`
The array of the items

## items.*.type `string` `required`
The type of the deleting item. Allowed types are `folder` or `file`.

## items.*.id `uuid` `required`
The ID of the item.

resources.name: File Chunks Upload
resources.description:
If you want to upload big files, sometimes you have to cut the files into many chunks and upload them one by one. This API endpoint gather these chunks and join them into one piece of file on the backend.
```
POST /api/file-request/{file_request_id}/upload/chunks

Accept: application/json
```
# URL Parameters

#### file_request_id `string`

# Payload
## name `string` `required`
The file name, must be the same for all file chunks

## chunk `file` `required`
The file or part of the file as a chunk

## extension `string` `required`
The file extension

## is_last_chunk `boolean` `required`
Determine if the sending file or chunk is the last one in upload queue

## parent_id `uuid`
The uuid of the parent folder. If it's not set, then the files will be uploaded into home location

## path `string`
The directory path of the file. Use it when you'd like to upload folder and recreate folder structure in the backend. E.g. `/Documents/Photos/wallpaper.jpg`

resources.name: File Upload
resources.description:
Simple file upload
```
POST /api/file-request/{file_request_id}/upload

Accept: application/json
```
# URL Parameters

#### file_request_id `string`

# Payload
## name `string` `required`
The file name, must be the same for all file chunks

## file `file` `required`
The file or part of the file as a chunk

## extension `string` `required`
The file extension

## parent_id `uuid`
The uuid of the parent folder. If it's not set, then the files will be uploaded into home location

## path `string`
The directory path of the file. Use it when you'd like to upload folder and recreate folder structure in the backend. E.g. `/Documents/Photos/wallpaper.jpg`

resources.name: Remote Upload
resources.description:
Upload remotely files from URL
```
POST /api/file-request/{file_request_id}/upload/remote

Accept: application/json
```
# URL Parameters

#### file_request_id `string`

# Payload
## parent_id `uuid`
The uuid of the parent folder. If it's not set, then the files will be uploaded into home location


## urls `array` `required`
The array of valid file urls to download remotely
